docs.summary: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is created.
description:
The `onAccountCreated()` event handler runs when a loyalty account is created. The received `AccountCreated` object contains information about the loyalty account that was created.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is created
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when the points of a loyalty account are adjusted, earned, or redeemed.
description:
The `onAccountPointsUpdated()` event handler runs when the points of a loyalty account are adjusted, earned, or redeemed. The received `AccountPointsUpdated` object contains information about the loyalty account that was updated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that triggered when a the points of a loyalty account is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
console.log('Latest transaction in this account: ', recentTransaction);

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is updated.
description:
The `onAccountUpdated()` event handler runs when a loyalty account is updated. The received `AccountUpdated` object contains information about the loyalty account that was updated.

The event also runs every 15 minutes when loyalty points are recalculated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.
console.log('Account was last updated on ', updatedDate);

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the loyalty program that was updated and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a loyalty program is updated.
description:
The `onProgramUpdated()` event handler runs when the name or the point definition of the loyalty program is updated. The received `ProgramUpdated` object contains information about the program that was updated.

`onProgramUpdated()` does not trigger when the loyalty program's status changes.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event triggered when a loyalty program is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

members.name: sourceAccounts
members.doc: Source accounts.

members.name: updatedAccount
members.doc: Merged account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9999999`

Max: `9999999`

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999999999`

members.name: description
members.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9999999`

Max: `9999999`

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999999999`

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: id
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.name: previousProviderReferenceIds
members.doc: Previous provider reference IDs. Used for when a subscription is extended, specifically for domains.

members.name: providerName
members.doc:
Name of the billing system that manages the subscription.

+ `"UNKNOWN"`: Default value.
+ `"SBS"`: [Wix Billing](https://github.com/wix-p/premium-billing/tree/master/sbs).
+ `"LICENSER"`:
+ `"BASS"`: [Billing and Subscriptions System](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/drafts/subscriptions-by-billing-by-wix/introduction).
+ `"RESELLER"`: [External Reseller](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/account-level-apis/resellers/introduction).

members.name: providerReferenceId
members.doc: Current provider reference ID.

members.name: cancellationCode
members.doc:
Cancellation code.

Values supported for cancellations on behalf of the billing system: `-1`, `-2`, `-3`, `-4`, `-5`, `-6`, `-7`, `-8`.
For cancellations on behalf of the site owner or the service provider `cancellationCode`
is taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).

+ `-1`: The subscription has been cancelled by the billing system but none of the listed cancellation reasons applies.
+ `-2`: There were payment problems.
+ `-3`: There was a chargeback.
+ `-4`: Customer support has canceled the subscription and issued a refund.
+ `-5`: The site owner has changed their existing subscription.
+ `-6`: The subscription has been transferred to a different Wix account.
+ `-7`: The subscription has been canceled because the site owner hasn't manually authenticated the recurring payment during the subscription's grace period. For example, site owners must manually confirm recurring payments within 40 days when paying with boleto.
+ `-8`: The Wix account that the subscription belonged to has been deleted.

members.name: cancellationReason
members.doc:
Cancellation reason. For cancellations on behalf of the site owner or the service provider `cancellationReason`
is taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).
For cancellations on behalf of the billing system `cancellationReason` is `null` or an empty string.

members.name: initiator
members.doc:
Initiator of the cancellation. For `"USER_REQUESTED"` and `"APP_MANAGED"`,
`cancellationCode` and `cancellationReason` are taken from the request of
[Cancel Immediately](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately)
or [Cancel Immediately Offline](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-subscriptions-manager/cancel-immediately-offline).
For `"PASSIVE"`, cancellations `cancellationCode` is automatically calculated and `cancellationReason`
is `null` or an empty string.

+ `"UNKNOWN`: Default value.
+ `"USER_REQUESTED"`:  The Wix account owner has canceled the subscription.
+ `"APP_MANAGED"`: The service provider has canceled the subscription.
+ `"PASSIVE"`: The billing system has canceled the subscription. For example, in case of payment failure or fraud.

description: Information about the cancellation flow including who canceled the subscription and why it was canceled.

members.name: contractSwitchReason
members.doc:
Update reason.

+ `"PRICE_INCREASE"`: The subscription's price has been increased.
+ `"EXTERNAL_PROVIDER_TRIGGER"`: Any reason other than a price increase.

members.name: contractSwitchType
members.doc:
Update type. __Note__: Doesn't include information about a product adjustment.
For that purpose, see `productAdjustment`.

+ `"NOT_APPLICABLE"`: Default value.
+ `"ADDITIONAL_QUANTITY"`: An increased usage quota is added to the subscription. For example, a second mailbox is added to a subscription that previously included a single mailbox.
+ `"CREDIT_UNUSED_PERIOD"`: The subscription is upgraded and the new price is less than the regular price. The new price applies to every billing cycle, not just the first cycle.
+ `"REFUND_PRICE_DIFF"`: Not implemented.
+ `"ADJUST_PERIOD_END"`: Not implemented.
+ `"DOWNGRADE_GRACE_PERIOD"`: For downgrades during the grace period. In this situation, the site owner hasnâ€™t paid yet and must immediately pay for the downgraded subscription.
+ `"FULL_AMOUNT_PERIOD"`: For upgrades in which the site owner retains unused benefits. For example, site owners upgrading a Facebook Ads subscription retain their unused FB Ads credit. The unused credit is added to the new credit.
+ `"END_OF_PERIOD"`: The subscription's billing current cycle is extended because of a downgrade.
+ `"PENDING_CHANGES"`: The subscription's billing is updated, but the change doesn't apply immediately. Instead, the update becomes effective at the end of current billing cycle.
+ `"DOWNGRADE_RENEWAL"`: The subscription is downgraded because of a declined payment. This prevents subscriptions from churning.

members.name: previousCycle
members.doc: Billing cycle before the update.

members.name: previousMetaSiteId
members.doc:
ID of the metasite the subscription has been assigned to previously.
Available only in case the subscription is assigned to a different site.

members.name: previousProductId
members.doc: ID of the product belonging to the subscription before the update.

members.name: previousProductTypeId
members.doc: ID of the product type that the subscription's original product belonged to before the update.

members.name: productAdjustment
members.doc:
Information about a product adjustment. For example, a downgrade.
__Note__: This isn't the same as `contractSwitchType`.

+ `NOT_APPLICABLE`: There is no information about whether the product has been up- or downgraded.
+ `DOWNGRADE`: The product has been downgraded.

members.name: productPriceIncreaseData
members.doc: Information about the price update. Available only for updates with a price increase.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Updated subscription.

description:
Triggered when a subscription was updated including when its product has been
up- or downgraded or the billing cycle is changed.

members.name: contactId
members.doc:
Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: interval
members.doc: repetitive interval

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: one time

members.name: interval
members.doc: repetitive interval

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: one time

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9999999`

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

members.name: account
members.doc: Updated loyalty account.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) to learn more.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object) to learn more.

members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) to learn more.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object) to learn more.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the account to retrieve.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: points
members.doc: Point totals for the entire program.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

description: Retrieves a transaction.

members.name: transaction
members.doc: Retrieved transaction.

members.name: count
members.doc: number of interval

members.name: unit
members.doc: interval unit of measure

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the transaction was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Amount of earned, adjusted, or redeemed points in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `"ADJUST"`, `"EARN"`, or `"GIVE"`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Description of the latest transaction.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
nique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc:
Additional information for redeemed points.

Only present if `type` is `"REDEEM"`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Transaction type.

+ `"EARN"`: Points were earned by the customer taking an action. See [Earn Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).
+ `"REDEEM"`: Points were redeemed by the customer for a reward.
+ `"ADJUST"`: Point balance was manually adjusted to a loyalty account. See [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).
+ `"GIVE"`: Points were manually added to or subtracted from a loyalty account. See [Adjust Points](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/adjust-points).

members.name: contactIds
members.doc: List of contact IDs. See the [Contacts API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object) to learn more.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Pagination options.

description: Options to use when retrieving a list of loyalty accounts.

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: transactions
members.doc: Retrieved transactions.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load. Minimum `1`, maximum `50`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: accounts
members.doc: Loyalty accounts.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Account ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the account was last updated.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc: Account's last activity date and time.

members.name: latestTransaction
members.doc: Details of the account's latest transaction.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: points
members.doc: Information about the account totals.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the loyalty account is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty account.

Ignored when creating an account.

members.name: rewardAvailable
members.doc: Whether the account has a reward available. `true` if the amount of points in `points.balance` are enough to redeem for a reward.

members.name: tier
members.doc:
Tier information.

The Loyalty Tiers API is currently unavailable, but the program may be activated and managed from a site's
[loyalty dashboard](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Floyalty-accounts/wizard/).

description:
A loyalty account stores a customer's loyalty points balance. A site's customers can earn points to their account
and redeem those points for rewards.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Metasite ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Current point balance.

Equal to the sum of `earned` and `adjusted` points, minus `redeemed` points.

members.name: earned
members.doc: Total earned points.

members.name: redeemed
members.doc: Total redeemed points.

members.name: account
members.doc: Updated account.

members.name: previousPrice
members.doc: Price of the subscription before the update.

description: Triggered when a subscription's price is increased.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Subscription for which the recurring charge has succeeded.

description: Triggered when a recurring charge succeeds for a subscription.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc:
ID of the specific item that was redeemed in this transaction.

Each reward that is redeemed has a unique `referenceEntityId`.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: ID of the reward that was redeemed.

members.name: rewardType
members.doc: Type of reward that was redeemed.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of times the given reward will be redeemed. Must be a positive whole number.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc: Id of the entity that is being redeemed (e.g. orderId for order discount, couponId for coupon reward).

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when redeeming points.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: updateTrigger
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'BALANCE_UPDATED'`
- `'REWARD_UPDATED'`
- `'TIERS_RECALCULATED'`
- `'UNDEFINED'`

members.name: durationInMonths
members.doc:
Number of months to use for the rolling window period.

Min: `12`
Max: `36`

description: *Required.** Period of time used to calculate loyalty points for tier assignment.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the subscription.

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the subscription is active. Includes the statuses
`"AUTO_RENEW_ON"`, `"AUTO_RENEW_OFF"`, and `"MANUAL_RECURRING"`.

members.name: billingReference
members.doc: Information about the system that manages the subscription's billing.

members.name: countryCode
members.doc:
2-letter country code in
[ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements)
format.

members.name: createdAt
members.doc:
Date and time the subscription was created in
[UTC datetime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time)
`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ` format.

members.name: cycle
members.doc: Information about the billing cycle of the subscription.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc:
ID of the metasite that the subscription is assigned to.
Available only when the subscription is assigned to a Wix site.
Subscriptions for account level products can't be assigned to a Wix site.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Custom metadata about the subscription.

members.name: originalCreationDate
members.doc:
Date and time the subscription was originally created in
[UTC datetime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time)
`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ` format.
Differs from `createdAt` in case the subscription was originally created for a different Wix account and has been transferred.

members.name: productId
members.doc:
ID of the [product](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/products/product-object)
for which the subscription was purchased.

members.name: productTypeId
members.doc:
ID of the [product type](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/premium/premium-product-catalog-v2/product-types/product-type-object)
that the product, for which the subscription was purchased, belongs to.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Subscription status.

+ `UNKNOWN`: Default status.
+ `AUTO_RENEW_ON`: Subscription is active and automatically renews at the end of the current billing cycle.
+ `AUTO_RENEW_OFF`: Subscription is active but expires at the end of the current billing cycle.
+ `MANUAL_RECURRING`: Subscription is active and renews at the end of the current billing cycle, in case the customer takes an action related to the payment.
+ `CANCELLED`: Subscription isn't active because it has been canceled.
+ `TRANSFERRED`: Subscription isn't active because it has been transferred to a different account. A different active subscription was created for the target account.

members.name: transferredAt
members.doc:
Date and time the subscription was last transferred from one Wix account to
another in
[UTC datetime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time)
`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ` format.

members.name: updatedAt
members.doc:
Date and time the subscription was last updated in
[UTC datetime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time)
`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ` format.

members.name: userId
members.doc: ID of the Wix account that purchased the subscription.

members.name: version
members.doc: Version number, which increments by 1 each time the subscription is updated.

description:
A subscription holds information about a Premium product that a Wix account
owner has purchased including details about the billing.

members.name: previousMetaSiteId
members.doc: ID of the metasite that the subscription has been assigned to before the update.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Assigned subscription.

description:
Triggered when a subscription is assigned to a Wix site, including the initial
assignment of a floating subscription or a re-assignement from a different site.

members.name: cancellationDetails
members.doc: Details about the cancellation including who canceled the subscription and why.

members.name: immediateCancel
members.doc:
Whether the subscription is immediately canceled or expires at the end of the current billing cycle.

Default: `false`

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Subscription for which auto renew is turned off.

description: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned off.

members.name: initiator
members.doc:
Supported values: `USER`, `APP`.

Information about who turned auto renew on.
+ `"USER"`: The site owner who purchased the subscription has turned auto renew on.
+ `"APP"`: The service provider has turned auto renew on.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Subscription for which auto renew is turned on.

description: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned on.

members.name: cancellationDetails
members.doc: Details about the cancellation including who canceled the subscription and why.

members.name: immediateCancel
members.doc:
Whether the subscription is canceled immediately or expires at the end of the current billing cycle.

Default: `false`

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Canceled subscription.

description: Triggered when a subscription is canceled.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Metadata for the `created` event.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Created subscription.

description: Triggered when a subscription is created.

members.name: assigned
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is assigned to a Wix site, including the initial
assignment of a floating subscription or a re-assignement from a different site.

members.name: autoRenewTurnedOff
members.doc: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned off.

members.name: autoRenewTurnedOn
members.doc: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned on.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Triggered when a subscription is canceled.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription was updated including when its product has been
up- or downgraded or the billing cycle is changed.

members.name: created
members.doc: Triggered when a subscription is created.

members.name: eventDate
members.doc:
Date and time of the event in
[UTC datetime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time)
`YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ` format.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: ID of the subscription's event.

members.name: nearEndOfPeriod
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription gets close to the end of its billing cycle.
The exact number of days is defined in the billing system.

members.name: pendingChange
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is updated and the change doesn't happen
immediately but at the end of the current billing cycle.

members.name: recurringChargeSucceeded
members.doc: Triggered when a recurring charge succeeds for a subscription.

members.name: transferred
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is transferred from one Wix account to another.
A transfer includes cancelling the original subscription and creating a new
subscription for the target account. The event returns both the original
and the new subscription.

members.name: unassigned
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is unassigned from a Wix site and becomes
floating.

members.name: assigned
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is assigned to a Wix site, including the initial
assignment of a floating subscription or a re-assignement from a different site.

members.name: autoRenewTurnedOff
members.doc: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned off.

members.name: autoRenewTurnedOn
members.doc: Triggered when the subscription's auto renew is turned on.

members.name: cancelled
members.doc: Triggered when a subscription is canceled.

members.name: contractSwitched
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription was updated including when its product has been
up- or downgraded or the billing cycle is changed.

members.name: created
members.doc: Triggered when a subscription is created.

members.name: nearEndOfPeriod
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription gets close to the end of its billing cycle.
The exact number of days is defined in the billing system.

members.name: pendingChange
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is updated and the change doesn't happen
immediately but at the end of the current billing cycle.

members.name: recurringChargeSucceeded
members.doc: Triggered when a recurring charge succeeds for a subscription.

members.name: transferred
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is transferred from one Wix account to another.
A transfer includes cancelling the original subscription and creating a new
subscription for the target account. The event returns both the original
and the new subscription.

members.name: unassigned
members.doc:
Triggered when a subscription is unassigned from a Wix site and becomes
floating.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Subscription that got close to the end of its billing cycle.

description:
Triggered when a subscription gets close to the end of its billing cycle.
The exact number of days is defined in the billing system.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Subscription for which a pending update is triggered.

description:
Triggered when a subscription is updated and the change doesn't happen
immediately but at the end of the current billing cycle.

members.name: originSubscription
members.doc: Original subscription that was canceled for the transfer.

members.name: targetSubscription
members.doc: Newly created subscription for the target account.

description:
Triggered when a subscription is transferred from one Wix account to another.
A transfer includes cancelling the original subscription and creating a new
subscription for the target account. The event returns both the original
and the new subscription.

members.name: previousMetaSiteId
members.doc: ID of the metasite that the subscription has been assigned to before the event.

members.name: subscription
members.doc: Unassigned subscription.

members.name: unassignReason
members.doc:
Reason why the subscription is unassigned.

+ `"UNKNOWN"`: Default value.
+ `"USER_REQUESTED"`: The Wix account owner has unassigned the subscription.
+ `"REPLACED_BY_ANOTHER_SUBSCRIPTION"`: A different subscription that replaces this subscription is assigned to the site.

description:
Triggered when a subscription is unassigned from a Wix site and becomes
floating.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Tier ID.

This field will not be returned if the account belongs to the base tier.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the tier information was last recalculated.

members.name: points
members.doc: Points earned and adjusted over the tier's current rolling window.

description: Tier information.

members.name: description
members.doc: Tier description.

members.name: icon
members.doc: Tier icon.

members.name: name
members.doc: Tier name.

description: Information about the base loyalty tier.

members.name: _id
members.doc: If None, Account belongs to base Tier

members.name: numberOfAccounts
members.doc: Total number of loyalty accounts, that belongs to particular Tier

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the loyalty tiers program was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the loyalty tiers program was last updated.

members.name: baseTierDefinition
members.doc: Information about the base loyalty tier.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by `1` each time the loyalty tiers settings are updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty tiers settings.

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc:
*Required.** Period of time used to calculate loyalty points for tier assignment.

The loyalty points accumulated during this period determine if the account meets a tier's required point threshold.

members.name: status
members.doc: Tiers program status.

description: There can be single TiersSettings per site and it's global (i.e. applies to all program's tiers)

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc:
*Required.** Period of time used to calculate loyalty points for tier assignment.

The loyalty points accumulated during this period determine if the account meets a tier's required point threshold.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Points earned, adjusted, or redeemed in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `"ADJUST`, `"EARN"`, or `"GIVE"`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceAppId`.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: description
members.doc: Transaction description. Only present for automated transactions of `type` `"EARN"` or `"REDEEM"`, when set by the site owner in the Business Manager.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc: Additional redeem information. Only present if `type` is `"REDEEM"`.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADJUST'`
- `'EARN'`
- `'GIVE'`
- `'REDEEM'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

description: Loyalty transaction.

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Activated loyalty program.

members.name: state
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'DEMO'`
- `'DISABLED'`
- `'ENABLED'`
- `'PENDING'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: id
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (for example, [GDPR](https://support.wix.com/en/article/gdpr-frequently-asked-questions)). For advanced users.

members.name: metaSiteIds
members.doc: Metasite IDs.

members.name: programInSites
members.doc: Retrieved loyalty programs.

members.name: deleteStatus
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'DELETED'`
- `'PENDING_PURGE'`
- `'TRASH'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of description fields to retrieve. Supported values: `description`, `updatedDate`.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest description update.

members.name: description
members.doc: Retrieved loyalty program description.

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Retrieved loyalty program.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the program was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the program was updated.

members.name: name
members.doc: Program name.

members.name: pointDefinition
members.doc: Details about the program's collectible unit.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Program status. Customers can only earn or redeem points while the program is `"ACTIVE"`.

Default: `"DRAFT"`

description:
A loyalty program allows sites to maintain customer reward accounts. Site owners can create a
loyalty program to increase customer retention. Read more about the loyalty program in
[this overview](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-loyalty-program-an-overview).

members.name: newNamespace
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACCOUNT_MASTER_CMS'`
- `'ALBUMS'`
- `'ANYWHERE'`
- `'CLUBS'`
- `'CREATOR_ECONOMY'`
- `'DASHBOARD_FIRST'`
- `'DEV_CENTER_COMPANY'`
- `'DEV_SITE'`
- `'HEADLESS'`
- `'HOTELS'`
- `'HTML_DRAFT'`
- `'LOGOS'`
- `'ONBOARDING_DRAFT'`
- `'PARTNER_DASHBOARD'`
- `'SHOUT_OUT'`
- `'SITELESS_BUSINESS'`
- `'UNKNOWN_NAMESPACE'`
- `'VIDEO_MAKER'`
- `'WIX'`
- `'WIX_STORES_TEST_DRIVE'`

members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACCOUNT_MASTER_CMS'`
- `'ALBUMS'`
- `'ANYWHERE'`
- `'CLUBS'`
- `'CREATOR_ECONOMY'`
- `'DASHBOARD_FIRST'`

- `'HEADLESS'`
- `'HOTELS'`
- `'HTML_DRAFT'`
- `'LOGOS'`
- `'ONBOARDING_DRAFT'`
- `'PARTNER_DASHBOARD'`
- `'SHOUT_OUT'`
- `'SITELESS_BUSINESS'`
- `'UNKNOWN_NAMESPACE'`
- `'VIDEO_MAKER'`
- `'WIX'`
- `'WIX_STORES_TEST_DRIVE'`

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Paused loyalty program.

members.name: customName
members.doc:
Display name for the program's collectible unit. It's recommended to use the plural, for example
`"Stars"`. In contrast to a custom name, the default `"Points"` name is translated and adjusted to singular based
on circumstances.

Default: `"Points"`

Max: 20 characters

members.name: icon
members.doc: Details about the points icon.

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Loyalty program.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Metasite ID.

members.name: entity
members.doc: Updated loyalty program.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Event metadata.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: Either UUID or EmbeddedServiceType.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: Not only UUID. Something here could be something weird.

members.name: context
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'DUPLICATE'`
- `'DUPLICATE_BY_SITE_TRANSFER'`
- `'FLASH'`
- `'FROM_TEMPLATE'`
- `'OLD_SITE_TRANSFER'`
- `'OTHER'`

members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACCOUNT_MASTER_CMS'`
- `'ALBUMS'`
- `'ANYWHERE'`
- `'CLUBS'`
- `'CREATOR_ECONOMY'`
- `'DASHBOARD_FIRST'`

- `'DEV_SITE'`
- `'HEADLESS'`
- `'HOTELS'`
- `'HTML_DRAFT'`
- `'LOGOS'`
- `'ONBOARDING_DRAFT'`
- `'PARTNER_DASHBOARD'`
- `'SHOUT_OUT'`
- `'SITELESS_BUSINESS'`
- `'UNKNOWN_NAMESPACE'`
- `'VIDEO_MAKER'`
- `'WIX'`

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

description: Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.
Hard deletion of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.
Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

description: Site transferred to another user.
Restoration of the meta site.

members.name: description
members.doc: Loyalty program description to update.

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Loyalty program fields to update.

members.name: loyaltyProgram
members.doc: Updated loyalty program.
